body_html:
The error means that some component inside the object can't be picklable (serializable).
Probably this means the model_fn didn't serialize. (I'm not sure because your error doesn't have info about object like this Can't pickle <function _model_fn at 0x108802140>:).

Two things:

  1. Try using Estimator, because TensorFlowEstimator is deprecated.
  2. You can try to move whatever you passing to model_fn into separate module and import it. This may allow to serialize the pointer to function.

If pickling of the model_fn function doesn't work, you can always make a wrapper that will do the work of constructing new estimator and returning.

body:
The error means that some component inside the object can't be picklable (serializable).
Probably this means the `model_fn` didn't serialize. (I'm not sure because your error doesn't have info about object like this `Can't pickle <function _model_fn at 0x108802140>:`).

Two things:
1) Try using `Estimator`, because `TensorFlowEstimator` is deprecated.
2) You can try to move whatever you passing to `model_fn` into separate module and import it. This may allow to serialize the pointer to function.

If pickling of the `model_fn` function doesn't work, you can always make a wrapper that will do the work of constructing new estimator and returning.
